name: Traumatic Aortic Dissection with Hemothorax
chief_complaint: Sudden, tearing chest pain and difficulty breathing after a high-speed car crash
symptoms: Severe chest pain radiating to back
treatment: Immediate blood pressure control with IV beta-blockers
prognosis: Guarded - mortality >80% without immediate surgical intervention
description: A life-threatening condition where the inner layer of the aorta tears due to blunt trauma, causing blood to flow between the layers of the aortic wall (dissection) and into the pleural space (hemothorax). Often caused by rapid deceleration injuries.
